metadata.title: Thursday, 26th June, 2014
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)    what measures the Government has taken to assist the Society of Blind Persons in Kaputa Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b)    what measures the Government has taken to assist the Society access various empowerment funds administered by the Ministry.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the following roads in Pemba District will be rehabilitated

parts: (a)    how many nurses there were in public health facilities country-wide, as of April, 2014;
(b)    what the total required number of nurses is;
(c)    what measures have been taken to meet the shortfall;
(d)    when the full complement of nurses, country-wide, will be met; and
(e)    when the Government will employ enough medical doctors and other health personnel.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when works on the Luwingu-Nsombo-Chaba-Chilubi road will commence.
Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    what the Government’s preferred model for the Kaputa Water Project is;
(b)    when the money for the project was released;
(c)    which contractor was awarded the contract for the project;
(d)    whether the source of water for the project has been identified and, if not, why; and

(e)    who is supervising the project on behalf of the Government. NOTICE OF MOTION AND ORDER OF THE DAY Mr Lubinda Report of the Parliamentary Select Committee:  That this House do adopt the Report of the Parliamentary Select Committee appointed to scrutinise the Presidential appointment of Mr Musa Mwenye, SC, to serve as Attorney-General of the Republic of Zambia and Mr Abraham Mwansa, to serve as Solicitor-General of the Republic of Zambia, for the Third Session of the Eleventh National Assembly, laid on the Table of the House on 18th June, 2014. 1    Report of the Committee on Economic Affairs, Energy and Labou r – Motion (19th June) – Resumption of Debate – (The Hon Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry).
